text: Gideon Welles (July 1, 1802 â€“ February 11, 1878) was the United States Secretary of the Navy during the presidencies of Abraham Lincoln and Andrew Johnson. He served from March 7, 1861 until March 4, 1869. He was from Glastonbury, Connecticut. He was also the great grandfather of director, actor and screenwriter Orson Welles. ==References== Category:United States Secretaries of the Navy Category:1802 births Category:1878 deaths Category:Politicians from Connecticut Category:American abolitionists Category:Journalists from Connecticut Category:Lawyers from Connecticut Category:American literature Category:Members of the Cabinet of the United States
title: Gideon Welles
